description: The Ditto Protocol envelope of a Ditto Protocol message. This wraps the actual payload in the `value` field.
title: Ditto Protocol envelope

topic.description:
Contains information about the contents of the payload:
 * the affected Thing (namespace and Thing ID)
 * the type of operation (command/event, create/retrieve/modify/delete) 

Example: `com.acme/xdk_53/things/twin/commands/modify`

content-type.description: The content-type which describes the value of Ditto Protocol messages.

correlation-id.description: The correlation-id header is used for linking one message with another. It typically links a reply message with its requesting message.

ditto-originator.description: Contains the first authorization subject of the command that caused the sending of this message. Set by Ditto.

If-Match.description:
The `If-Match` header which has to conform to RFC-7232 (Conditional Requests). Common usages are:
 * optimistic locking by specifying the `ETag` from a previous response, e.g. `If-Match: "hash:a75ece4e"`
 * retrieving or modifying a resource only if it already exists, e.g. `If-Match: *`

If-None-Match.description: The `If-None-Match` header which has to conform to RFC-7232 (Conditional Requests).

response-required.description: Whether a response to a command is required or if it may be omitted (fire and forget semantics).

requested-acks.description: Defining which acknowledgements ("ack") are requested for a command processed by Ditto.

items.description: A single acknowledgement label containing at least 3 characters.

timeout.description:
The timeout value to apply on the Ditto server side, e.g. applied when waiting for requested acknowledgements. Examples:
 * `42s`
 * `250ms`
 * `1m`
 * `60` (interpreted as seconds)

version.description: Determines the schema version of the payload.

condition.description: The `condition` header which should be valid RQL syntax.

path.description:
A Path that references a part of a Thing which is affected by this message.
Examples:
 * `/features/location/properties/longitude` (a single sensor value)
 * `/` (the whole Thing)

fields.description:
The fields that should be included in the response.
Example: `thingId,attributes(location)`

value.description: The `value` field contains the actual payload e.g. a sensor value.

extra.description: The `extra` object contains the `extraFields` which have optionally been selected to additionally be included.

revision.description: For events this field contains the revision number of the event.

timestamp.description: For events this field contains the modification timestamp of the event.
